newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Jakarta stocks seen firm on cement, stable rupiah.
newsitem.headline: Jakarta stocks seen firm on cement, stable rupiah.

text.p: Jakarta stocks are seen firm on Thursday, with continuing keen interest likely in the cement sector and stability in the currency market, brokers said.
"Cement stocks such as Indocement and Semen Cibinong are likely to continue to attract market attention as each of them has positive news," a broker with a local firm said.

He added that potential upside for Indocement was high after Indonesia's Coordinating Minister for Production and Distribution Hartarto said on Wednesday that the government supported a restructuring plan proposed by the firm.
Brokers said the stable rupiah coupled with sharp rises in the Dow Jones Industrial index overnight are likely to further boost overall market sentiment.
They also expected that trading would be more active today following the debut of medium-sized Bank Arya.
On Wednesday, the Jakarta Composite Index closed up 5.62 points, or 0.79 percent, at 721.98 points.
Arya rose to a high of 1,200 rupiah, compared with an offer price of 975 rupiah, before easing slightly to 1,175 rupiah in early morning trade.
The bank, which floated 98 million shares, posted a net profit of 8.83 billion rupiah in 1996, against 4.86 billion rupiah in 1995.
At an initial offer price of 975 rupiah per share, the price earnings ratio was 8.51 times based on expected 1997 net profit of 37.4 billion rupiah in 1997, the bank said.
Bank Danamon remained under selling pressure due to worries over the bank's expansion strategy in terms of loans and its branch network, brokers said.
Danamon fell 25 rupiah to 1,025 rupiah after touching a year low of 1,000 rupiah, with around two million shares traded.
